Headline: From Scaling Businesses to Leading Transformation | Sales, Growth, GTM & P&L Leadership | SaaS, AI/ML, IoT | CXO Partnerships | Building Future-Ready Businesses
Comment: I appreciate the emphasis on trust in the health industry, but I'm sceptical about the connection between a founder/VC s physical appearance and the trustworthiness of their product. Many factors contribute to someone's health and fitness, and it's unfair to assume that someone who may not look traditionally fit or healthy is incapable of creating a reliable and effective health product. I think it would be more valuable to focus on the product's research, testing, and scientific backing rather than the appearance of the founder/VC.

Comment:
Very true Dilip Kumar! If in health, we need to walk the talk. We owe it to our children. 

I was obese over 130+ kgs, and now 98.5 kgs, and still some way to go. I am building in the childhood obesity space and made a promise to myself and my future child. We are all human beings, but how many are healthy beings? Seeing my fatty liver reverse, was such a high moment. 

Wrote the following post on my aim to be healthy, and every team member will need to make a healthy promise. -https://www.linkedin.com/posts/surajprasad_letsinspire-healthrenaissance-personaljourney-activity-7156244789401653248-jnNo?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

Headline: ‡§Æ‡•à‡§Ç Yoddha I Devilslayer I Founder I Entrepreneur I Investor I Motivational Speaker
Comment: So I actually look at it a little differently Dilip Kumar. I believe that ‚Äúwalking the talk‚Äù so to speak not only gives you credibility but is in fact essential to building a health & wellness building. Beyond the superficiality of what one looks like, it is the ability to understand the space you operate in, the solutions you are building for your target customers, and the confidence that you have when you yourself have successfully tried those, that gives you a winning edge.¬†For example, in my case, I can definitely say that my own journey has largely influences the growth of our organisation and the path we have taken towards growth. The community which I cherish the most is a function of the connect I have been able to build with people and this has only been possible because I truly embibe what I talk about.
